title: Mission Description
content: The hunt for theFlame Reaverends in victory for the Chrysos Heirs. Now bearing the mission of attaining divinity, you face another crucial choice: Claim the throne or return home.

speaker: Mydei
line: I see the Reaper has forsaken you, too, teacher.

speaker: Krateros
line: Hmph, it simply put my life in the hands of the Twilight Courtyard .

speaker: Krateros
line: That priest girl 's medical talents are truly exceptional... She might be far from the ordinary girl we envisioned.

speaker: Krateros
line: But this isn't about me, Mydeimos. I saw it... You've finally decided to embrace your own fate.

speaker: Mydei
line: The power of Strife is stirring a tempest within me as we speak... My bones have turned into steel, and my blood is seething and ablaze. Past rulers of Kremnos could only aspire to this might, yet I have merged with it.

speaker: Mydei
line: I've made history, and henceforth, divinity and kingship shall coexist as one.

speaker: Krateros
line: Indeed. You've realized the aspirations of every former king of Kremnos.

speaker: Krateros
line: And now, you can at last bring our people home and reforge the glory of Kremnos.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Unfortunately, I harbor no such desire.

speaker: Krateros
line: Wha—What do you mean by that?

speaker: Mydei
line: Over two millennia past, devotees of Nikador 's might banded together beneath their feet and erected a city of their own. Ever since then, Kremnoans have served as the blades wielded by the god of war, following the Titan 's path in its conquest.

speaker: Mydei
line: Yet, gazing upon our history through the lens of my newfound divinity, I now see it with unprecedented clarity.

speaker: Mydei
line: This history is sheer absurdity and inferiority. People surged onto the battlefield like ants, plundering and slaying for their own greed, only to be trampled upon... like ants.

speaker: Mydei
line: The city and the beliefs that Kremnoans hold so dearly, alongside the supposed tradition... are mere anthills that can be crushed with a single touch in the eyes of the Titan.

speaker: Krateros
line: You...!

speaker: Krateros
line: Are you trying to strip Kremnoans of the pride we've amassed over thousands of years with mere words?!

speaker: Mydei
line: ...That pride holds little significance, Krateros. Now that I've assumed the divinity of Strife, my next step...

speaker: Mydei
line: Will be to renounce the title of "King."

speaker: Krateros
line: ...No! NO!

speaker: Mydei
line: Convey my message to every Kremnoan — this is an order.

speaker: Krateros
line: Do not do this, Mydeimos...

speaker: Krateros
line: I beg you...!

speaker: Mydei
line: Our history commenced in Year 2506 of the Light Calendar and concluded in Year 4931. I, Mydeimos, last King of Castrum Kremnos, son of Gorgo , do hereby proclaim...

speaker: Mydei
line: The Kremnoan dynasty comes to an official close today.

speaker: Krateros
line: You have killed us...

speaker: Krateros
line: You have killed us all...

speaker: Mydei
line: No, I am granting you a new beginning.

speaker: Krateros
line: What is this...

speaker: Mydei
line: My mother's signet ring. It served as a symbol of kingship, and I now imbue it with a fresh significance.

speaker: Mydei
line: Take it and rally those who have lost their identities. Convey the words of Mydeimos, now ascended to divinity:

speaker: Mydei
line: You no longer need to chase fleeting honors or face death on the battlefield as if it were your sole destination. However, you must adapt to fit into this city that you once observed with indifferent eyes.

speaker: Mydei
line: A cruel fate awaits Amphoreus . No matter how illustrious a dynasty may seem, it crumbles to rubble and gravel before formidable foes.

speaker: Mydei
line: Yet, you shall tread the only path out, one that leads to a brand-new world at its end.

speaker: Krateros
line: Why task me with being your messenger? Why not explain all this to them yourself?

speaker: Mydei
line: Because only humans can guide the path to be trodden by humans. It's not the lot of "humans" who crave the power of gods and spiral into madness for it...

speaker: Mydei
line: But "humans" who stand ready to raise their shields high to protect the lives behind them.

speaker: Krateros
line: I failed to save that child .

speaker: Mydei
line: That is irrelevant. As demigods , they have long been prepared for it.

speaker: Mydei
line: What truly matters is that you showed up there and shielded her.

speaker: Krateros
line: The one who persuaded Aglaea to set me free that night... Was that you, Mydeimos?

speaker: Mydei
line: Yes.

speaker: Krateros
line: She's not one to easily make a concession. What did you offer her?

speaker: Mydei
line: I staked my mother's name to guarantee the integrity of your soul to her, and...

speaker: Mydei
line: ...I promised her that I would dedicate all I have to the Flame-Chase Journey.

speaker: Krateros
line: And what is next, Mydeimos...?

speaker: Krateros
line: ...Where will you be headed now?

speaker: Mydei
line: To the place where I belong, to fulfill my promise.

speaker: Mydei
line: The madness that has plagued Nikador and the darkness that has consumed Amphoreus...

speaker: Mydei
line: It's now my turn to fight against it.

title: Step Description
content: You decisively reject the Kremnoans' centuries-old obsession with glory, opting to return home alone and assume Nikador's duty against theblack tide. Before starting your homeward journey, you need to say goodbye to your friends in the city.

speaker: Mydei
line: There are some people to meet with before I leave.

speaker: Mydei
line: Let's go.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You're here, Mydeimos...

speaker: Aglaea
line: It seems that you are prepared.

speaker: Mydei
line: Yes.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You aided Okhema through yet another trying ordeal, and my gratitude knows no bounds.

speaker: Mydei
line: Isn't that exactly what you wanted?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Not everything unfolds according to my plan. In the current state of the world, I can only proceed one step at a time. Furthermore...

speaker: Aglaea
line: You are ready to dedicate all that you have, regardless of the promise you made to me, aren't you?

speaker: Mydei
line: Throughout my time in the holy city, I've gleaned valuable lessons from you — strategy, leadership, and adaptability to change... Yet, it's only recently that I've come to realize the truly remarkable quality you possess.

speaker: Aglaea
line: And what is it?

speaker: Mydei
line: It's the magnetic allure in your presence. It draws people to gather around you willingly, to seek your guidance.

speaker: Mydei
line: They strive not to disappoint you, not due to fear of repercussions, but out of sincere alignment with your ideals.

speaker: Mydei
line: That is precisely what every ruler of Castrum Kremnos has been missing.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...I am truly honored to hear that.

speaker: Aglaea
line: And now, Mydeimos, you have risen as the most powerful demigod in the world. How do you intend to wield this newfound power?

speaker: Mydei
line: I shall see Nikador 's aborted mission through to completion, and become the strongest bulwark for Amphoreus to defend against the black tide.

speaker: Mydei
line: I will secure enough time for the Flame-Chase Journey until you manage to lead everyone to reach the miracle of "Genesis."

speaker: Aglaea
line: Mydeimos, a new chapter awaits Amphoreus... Yet, the one who guides the people to the destination need not be you and I.

speaker: Mydei
line: Hehe...

speaker: Mydei
line: What did you see after assuming Mnestia 's divinity?

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...Despite the passage of a thousand years, every word of that prophecy remains as vivid as ever.

speaker: Aglaea
line: "You shall have your final bath in warm and radiant gold."

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Heh, just as cryptic as all the other prophecies.

speaker: Mydei
line: Haha...

speaker: Aglaea
line: What's the reason for the laughter?

speaker: Mydei
line: I was just thinking... if an ordinary person encountered these words, they would probably stay away from the baths for the rest of their life.

speaker: Aglaea
line: But I cannot forgo the delightful experience a bath offers.

speaker: Aglaea
line: So, I assume you also glimpsed yours, Mydeimos?

speaker: Mydei
line: "One day, you shall die with a wound in your back."

speaker: Aglaea
line: Well, that is a rather straightforward scenario.

speaker: Mydei
line: If I were to be terrified by drivel with no basis, I would not have attracted your gaze and joined the Flame-Chase Journey in the first place.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You speak the truth. May you be destined for a powerful fate, and may we reunite in the promised new world...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Farewell, Mydei.

text: Bid farewell to the Trailblazer and Dan Heng

speaker: Aglaea
line: Farewell, Mydei.

speaker: Chartonus
line: The King of Kremnos, without the signet ring... But looking more like a king now.

speaker: Mydei
line: I'm no longer the "king," Grand Craftsman.

speaker: Chartonus
line: Matters not, the title. Surpassed all former kings, your achievements have.

speaker: Mydei
line: I will honor your trust and liberate the world from the clutches of fear.

speaker: Mydei
line: Nevertheless, I must request that you continue to watch over Phainon, Chartonus. I have a feeling that his fate... will weigh heavier than all of ours combined.

speaker: Chartonus
line: Keep Phainon in mind, I will. Return to your home, brave king.

speaker: Chartonus
line: Together with everyone, I shall remain here. That thunder... from Castrum Kremnos, we wait to hear.

text: (Approach marked location in theGarden of Life, optional)

speaker: Mydei
line: Is Lady Tribios not here...?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Lord Mydei!

speaker: Mydei
line: Hyacine?

speaker: Mydei
line: So you are the physician Krateros spoke of. It's no wonder then that he was pulled back from the brink of death. You have my gratitude.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Heh... I can take that as a compliment, right?

speaker: Mydei
line: I've heard about what happened at the Grove . I am deeply sorry for your loss.

speaker: Hyacine
line: ...I've heard far too much about death and grief recently. To quote Lady Tribbie, we should all focus on tomorrow, shouldn't we?

speaker: Mydei
line: That's a valid point... You have always been the most optimistic one among us.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Well, I must say, it feels quite incredible... to see a new demigod standing right before me.

speaker: Mydei
line: You should prepare yourself as well.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Humanity has already taken hold of "Strife," and one day, they will also reach the "Sky."

speaker: Hyacine
line: ...Do you really believe I can do it? Even my ancestor, that hero of legends, couldn't conquer the Coreflame of Aquila .

speaker: Mydei
line: Given your good rapport with the demigods, you should know that the path to assuming divinity is never limited to swords and spears.

speaker: Hyacine
line: You've always been so perceptive, Lord Mydei. Rest assured. If fate has truly selected me, I will be ready.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Right. You are here looking for Lady Tribbie and Lady Trinnon , no? They're not around at the moment. Is there a message you'd like me to pass on to them?

speaker: Mydei
line: No need. I have already bid farewell to Aglaea. Meeting with the oracle is simply a matter of courtesy.

speaker: Hyacine
line: You've bid... farewell?

speaker: Mydei
line: I'm heading back to Castrum Kremnos to fight against the black tide. In all likelihood, I will never again return to Okhema.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Oh...

speaker: Mydei
line: On second thought, there is something that I'd like you to help me convey to them.

speaker: Hyacine
line: I'm all ears, Lord Mydei. I'll make sure to convey every single word.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Tell them that there is no longer a need to send scouts behind enemy lines. With a single message, the Lance of Fury will target anyone who dares oppose Okhema.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...Lord Mydei.

speaker: Mydei
line: I'll be embracing my destiny before you do, Castorice.

speaker: Castorice
line: Can you... feel Thanatos right now?

speaker: Mydei
line: I don't feel them at all, regrettably.

speaker: Mydei
line: You have been painstakingly seeking that Titan for so long, but have you ever considered reaching out to me for help?

speaker: Castorice
line: You mean...?

speaker: Mydei
line: Death refused to ferry me. If you were to send me to the nether realm, I may uncover clues along the way back.

speaker: Castorice
line: I would never do that, Lord Mydei. Death is not a game.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...You're right. That may very well be the reason why my people have struggled for millennia — they underestimated the significance of death.

speaker: Castorice
line: So, are you returning home alone, Lord Mydei?

speaker: Mydei
line: Returning home, you say... Heh, maybe. At this moment, Castrum Kremnos is not just my birthplace, but also my fated destination.

speaker: Mydei
line: Work harder, Castorice. Go and do what you have to do, so that the trials we have endured may have meaning.

speaker: Castorice
line: I will, Lord Mydei.

speaker: Castorice
line: May we reunite on the other side, where the warm west wind blows.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...Mydei?

speaker: Mydei
line: Outlanders... no, Trailblazers, I will soon make my way to Castrum Kremnos.

speaker: Mydei
line: If all goes according to plan, this may be our final meeting. I just want to let you know that I appreciate everything you have done for Amphoreus.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Reflecting on the past and moving forward to the future — a challenge I've faced as well.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Though we never had a chance for a deep conversation, after all we've experienced together... you are also an ally of the Trailblaze , Mydei.

speaker: Mydei
line: That means a lot to me. May success accompany your Trailblazing wherever it leads.

speaker: Mydei
line: Heh... How about you let me guess what's on your mind?

text: I guess... ( He / She ) will say something inspiring.

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Are you thinking about... saying something inspiring?

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ ...Eat more greens, work out more often, avoid mindless reads, and get more sleep.

text: I guess... ( He / She ) will say something sentimental.

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Are you drafting... a sentimental farewell speech?

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ ...Stay safe out there. A lone boy can get into a lot of trouble.

text: I guess... ( He / She ) will say something nonsensical.

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Are you going to say something insane again, Trailblazer?

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ *sob* ...What are we going to do without you?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Just smile if you don't know how to respond.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Haha.

speaker: Mydei
line: Now that I bear the divine within me, I can get the vague feeling that... that you have a great significance for the future of Amphoreus.

speaker: Mydei
line: With this departure, I fear that I will never again return. Can I entrust you both to watch my back... and to continue supporting the Flame-Chase Journey in my absence?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...Rest assured. We'll do everything we can.

speaker: Mydei
line: You have my gratitude. Then, farewell.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ ...Hold on.

speaker: Mydei
line: Yes?

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ Let's at least snap a photo together to capture this moment, shall we?

speaker: Mydei
line: Hah... Sure. Let's do it.

text: Take a commemorative photo with the Trailblazer and Dan Heng

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ Let's at least snap a photo together to capture this moment, shall we?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Looks pretty good. What do you think, Mydei?

speaker: Mydei
line: Hmph, well... It feels peculiar, I suppose? I'm not talking about your photographic skills. It's just that I rarely take photos...

speaker: Mydei
line: But this one... It's pretty good.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ I never fail to impress.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I'm glad you like it. Make sure not to leave any regrets behind.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...I wish the same for you during your time in Amphoreus.

speaker: Andriskos
line: The prince is here. Run!

speaker: Marsyas
line: Hold on! Lord Mydeimos isn't the prince anymore... He's now the Guardian of Amphoreus !

speaker: Mydei
line: What's going on?

speaker: Demetri
line: We salute the Guardian of Amphoreus!

speaker: Adult male
line: We salute you.

speaker: Adult female
line: May triumph always be yours.

speaker: Adult male
line: May glory be with you.

speaker: Adult female
line: Return home on our behalf, Guardian!

speaker: Adult male
line: We dedicate our lives to following you.

speaker: Adult female
line: You will forever be our king.

speaker: Adult male
line: Farewell... Savior of Kremnos.

speaker: Adult female
line: Enlighten us with your guidance.

speaker: Adult male
line: May glory be with you.

speaker: Adult female
line: We salute you.

speaker: Adult male
line: May triumph always be yours.

speaker: Adult female
line: May glory be with you.

speaker: Adult male
line: Enlighten us with your guidance.

speaker: Adult female
line: You will forever be our king.

speaker: Adult male
line: We dedicate our lives to following you.

speaker: Adult male
line: May triumph always be yours, King of Kremnos.

speaker: Adult female
line: Farewell, Mydeimos!

speaker: Adult male
line: Please fend off the black tide for us, Guardian...

speaker: Adult female
line: Glory belongs to you, son of Gorgo!

speaker: Phainon
line: It's been a while, "Guardian."

text:
(Players should complete optional step before continuing past this point as there is no returning to it past this point)
(Approach Phainon)

speaker: Mydei
line: Hmph, I should've known you were the mastermind behind this.

speaker: Phainon
line: Hey, don't go pointing fingers without cause. I swear I'm innocent this time.

speaker: Phainon
line: See those kids over there? They're the ones who brought everyone together.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...I admit, that took me by surprise.

speaker: Phainon
line: Were you seriously just going to sneak off without a word with me?

speaker: Mydei
line: Well, I was actually on my way to bid farewell to you, but ended up running into this.

speaker: Phainon
line: Oh... That's quite an honor, I suppose.

speaker: Phainon
line: We better not leave them waiting too long, don't you think?

speaker: Mydei
line: The road to Castrum Kremnos from here is long.

speaker: Mydei
line: Perhaps it wouldn't be a bad idea... to take a moment and etch their faces in my memory one last time.

text: Walk with Phainon for the last part of the journey

speaker: Mydei
line: I think I see... more than just the Kremnoans here.

speaker: Phainon
line: You're now the Guardian of Amphoreus , after all.

speaker: Adult male
line: Farewell, Guardian!

speaker: Adult female
line: We salute you!

speaker: Adult male
line: You're our hope!

speaker: Adult female
line: Have a safe journey.

speaker: Phainon
line: I'm thinking... Maybe it's about time the god of "Strife" gets a new name.

speaker: Phainon
line: How about the god of "Solidarity"? Or... " Preservation "? Dan Heng mentioned that one to me.

speaker: Mydei
line: I recommend that you steer clear of any situation that calls for naming things.

speaker: Phainon
line: Hah... I suppose "Strife" still fits you better.

speaker: Phainon
line: Alright... It's about time for us to part ways.

speaker: Phainon
line: Any final goodbyes you want to share? This might be your last chance.

speaker: Mydei
line: Hmph...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Why so quiet? I thought divinity would wash away some of your sentiments.

speaker: Mydei
line: Do you truly feel as carefree as you seem? Or... is this just a facade you wear?

speaker: Phainon
line: ...You know what, you sound just like Aglaea at this moment.

speaker: Phainon
line: But you're not off the mark... I just thought putting on a nonchalant front for this occasion might help us preserve some dignity.

speaker: Mydei
line: I can see through your deception even without the power of mind-reading.

speaker: Phainon
line: Am I really that terrible at controlling my facial expressions?

speaker: Phainon
line: Well, with that said... thank you for aiding me in defeating my archenemy, Mydeimos.

speaker: Mydei
line: No need to thank me.

speaker: Mydei
line: This triumph brings no delight, nor does it signify closure — you understand that more than me.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Indeed. In the end, I still haven't unraveled the mystery behind that black-robed swordmaster , and I can't even ascertain their demise.

speaker: Phainon
line: Maybe I've never managed to cut off my destiny.

speaker: Mydei
line: But that matters not. Pain may be cured, but scars remain, and they should not be effaced. Even with the divine might of Oronyx , you cannot stop the past from leaving its marks in our blind spots.

speaker: Mydei
line: Can you genuinely let go of everything as soon as that swordmaster is dead? That's impossible. Revenge is merely an obligation that must be carried out, and no one can find mental fulfillment through it.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...You're right.

speaker: Mydei
line: Look forward. Chew up and swallow your past, then make sure emptiness and bitterness are not the only flavors you know.

speaker: Mydei
line: Remember that there is a whole world behind you waiting to be saved.

speaker: Phainon
line: I will keep that in mind.

speaker: Mydei
line: I have a final favor to ask: Please look after the Kremnoan warriors in my absence.

speaker: Mydei
line: They will undoubtedly face challenges while assimilating into Okhema... It is my sole regret that I cannot stand by them during this time.

speaker: Phainon
line: Do not worry. Leave it to me.

speaker: Phainon
line: And while I'm at it, I'm going to find out if the Kremnoan language is really missing that many words.

speaker: Mydei
line: Hmph, the Kremnoan philosophy can never be encapsulated in a mere dictionary.

speaker: Mydei
line: But... if there's a chance in the next life, you should come visit my library.

speaker: Mydei
line: I'll be on my way, Deliverer. Remember to stay alive till the final act.

speaker: Phainon
line: Yes.

speaker: Phainon
line: Same goes for you. Don't die too easily —

speaker: Phainon
line: May triumph always be yours, Mydeimos.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Oh, right.

speaker: Mydei
line: One last question.

speaker: Phainon
line: Go ahead. You better not leave any regrets behind.

speaker: Mydei
line: Are you the one who told Chartonus about the signet ring?

speaker: Phainon
line: Well...

speaker: Phainon
line: Who knows?

speaker: Mydei
line: Hah... Hah...

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: Get up, my son! You showed great courage in today's training. Let's wrap it up for now.

speaker: Mydei
line: Yes, Mother.

speaker: Mydei
line: Mother... There's something I want to ask you.

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: What is it, Mydeimos?

speaker: Mydei
line: Why must we learn to fight?

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: It is for glory and honor, my son. For Kremnoans, mastery of swords and spears is ingrained from birth, and the battlefield is our destined end.

speaker: Mydei
line: Is that really the way it is, Mother?

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: What makes you say so?

speaker: Mydei
line: Because you don't sound entirely sure.

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: ...You're right, Mydeimos.

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: I once believed those words without question until your father cast you into the Sea of Souls.

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: It was at that moment I realized how everything I believed in was utterly hollow. Perhaps the spirit of Kremnos had once existed... but as greed bloomed in the hearts of humanity over the years, such spirit had long faded alongside our glory.

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: I no longer put my faith in any oath or doctrine. Now, I have just one role...

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: That of your mother, Mydeimos. Your guardian...

speaker: Mydei
line: ...That dream always ends there. The journey back to Castrum Kremnos is proving to be longer than expected.

speaker: Mydei
line: Krateros said that, shortly after my fall into the sea, my mother challenged my father to a duel — She died through Father's treachery, and I never saw her face.

speaker: Mydei
line: Yet each night, she would show up, waiting by the flickering firelight. I always anticipated the sequel to that dream, believing she had more words of wisdom or guidance to offer...

speaker: Mydei
line: But now... I think I have finally come to understand. That is all she wished to tell me.

speaker: Mydei
line: And now, I too am left with but one role…

title: Step Description
content: I, the undying Mydeimos, the Last Prince, the new God of Strife... now tread the blood-soaked road home.

speaker: Mydei
line: It is time for this journey to reach its end.

speaker: Adult female
line: Welcome back!

speaker: Adult male
line: We meet again, Your Highness.

speaker: Adult female
line: How was your training?

speaker: Adult male
line: You're looking well.

speaker: Adult female
line: I look forward to fighting beside you!

speaker: Adult male
line: May Nikador defend you.

speaker: Adult female
line: I'm going to beat you at the festival!

speaker: Perdikkas
line: Look, Mydeimos is back!

speaker: Hephaestion
line: We've got fresh pomegranate juice. Want to try some?

speaker: Partners
line: Welcome back!

speaker: Ptolemy
line: Say! Come and check out what I just wrote...

speaker: Leonnius
line: Mydeimos! Did you just come back from training?

speaker: Peucesta
line: It's... been a while.

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: Welcome home... Mydeimos.

speaker: Gorgo, Mydei's Mother
line: Have you found something deserving of your protection as well?

children.speaker: Crowd
children.line: The son of Gorgo will be crowned in blood!

children.speaker: Crowd
children.line: The son of Gorgo will be crowned in blood!

text: Year 4931 of the Light Calendar, Month of Balance Nikador — the Strife Titan, Lance of Fury — fell. Mydeimos, king of Kremnos, triumphed over the trial, and the new god was born.
On the following day, the Kremnoan dynasty, which had lasted for a thousand years, came to an end.
When you have a chance to make a choice, make one that you know you won't regret.
